overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a time-series forecasting approach for a short dataset (96 hourly points). The analyst identifies daily seasonality but notes insufficient data for complex models. The chosen method is a simple average of each hour across available days, repeated for the forecast horizon. The approach includes data grouping, mean calculation, and precision handling, prioritizing simplicity due to data limitations.
common_data_patterns: Presence of negative values and fluctuations
Complete data (no missing values in provided series)
key_insights: Short data length (4 days) limits complex modeling (e.g., SARIMA) due to insufficient seasonal cycles
Daily patterns (24-hour cycles) dominate the time-series structure
Inability to model weekly seasonality from limited weekday/weekend samples
Data rounding to match original precision (3 decimals) is explicitly addressed
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines statistical awareness (seasonality detection) with practical simplification. Includes multi-step data processing but avoids advanced modeling due to data constraints.
